results.title: So you're going on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
If pre-production meetings have been carefully enough organised then going on location should pose no problem. The location chosen is determined by the demands of the script, but before it is actually chosen permits for its use, budgetary considerations and familiarisation by the crew are essential. The film gives numerous hints for filming and graphically explains points of job allocations, camera use and lighting.

results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Discusses the processes of film editing from the preparation of the work print to the completion of a finished, edited film. Explains the processes of setting up the editing bench, rewinding, using the moviescope, splicing, breaking-down the work print, marking, adding dialogue and using the moviola.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Uses interviews with cinematographers including Lazlo Kovacs, Lee Garmes and James Crabe to explain the major points of motion picture photography and cameras. Defines and explains many techniques including dolly shots, lenses, camera movement, film speeds and camera focus.

results.title: Acting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Shows a stage actor during audition and his transition to a motion picture actor. Well known actors including Helen Hayes, Vincent Price, Henry Fonda, Jim Backus, Jean Stapleton, Jeff Corey, Royal Dano, Mariette Hartley, Janet McLachlan and Paul Newman appear and discuss problem areas that a film actor must deal with.

results.title: Film Australia's Australia
results.brief_description: The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Utilises materials dating back from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country in the early 1900s.
results.description: The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Utilises materials dating back from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country in the early 1900s.

results.title: Black Australia
results.creator_credit: Darrell Sibosado, Michael Brogan and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Film and video segments relevant to this topic have been selected with original footage accompanied by original soundtracks. This program represents aspects of Aboriginal culture in Australia, and focuses on Aboriginal identity. The program uses the unifying symbols found in what is now known as the Aboriginal flag. The three colours in the flag symbolise the Aboriginal way of perceiving: red (land and politics), black (identity and self determination), and yellow (art and spirituality). These three interlinked themes are explored in the film with a focus on stimulating deeper understanding by white Australia on Aboriginality, the attitudes of white Australians towards Aboriginal people, racism in Australia, both individual and institutional and the changes needed in attitude and action to achieve justice. Teacher’s Guide included. Presented by Annette Shun Wah. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrell Sibosado, Michael Brogan and Film Australia

results.title: Exploring futures
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
This program raises many questions, among them: How might futures compare with the past and present? To what extent can we shape our futures? Is all change necessarily progress? What are some factors supporting and constraining our influence on futures? What kind of future would you prefer? What range of choices are open to individuals groups and governments? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Presented by Annette Shun Wah. This video is divided into five themes: ATTITUDES TO WORK; CHOICES IN THE PAST; CHOICES TODAY; ISSUES IN THE WORKPLACE; THE CHANGING NATURE OF WORK.

Episode number 9 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.

results.title: Beliefs, values and customs
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Jan Punch and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
In order to cover some of the great diversity of Australian life over the years, 12 one-hour titles have been produced. “Beliefs, Values and Customs” is Part One of the two-part Cultural Environment and examines Aboriginal culture, the religions of Australia, the British heritage, a multicultural society , the influences of the mass media and advertising the Aussie image, sport, language and communication.
